benchmark_details.name: AM-DeepSeek-R1-Distilled
benchmark_details.overview: The AM-DeepSeek-R1-Distilled is a large-scale dataset with thinking traces for general reasoning tasks, composed of high-quality and challenging reasoning problems collected from various open-source datasets, ensuring high quality and correctness through stringent verification procedures.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a substantial resource for the research of reasoning-oriented large language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Responses in this dataset are generated by large language models and may have deficiencies in factual accuracy.

data.source: Collected from multiple open-source datasets, including mathematical problems, coding challenges, and scientific reasoning tasks.
data.annotation: Data entries are annotated with user-assistant interaction, reasoning processes, final answers, reference answers, test cases, and additional metadata.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is computed as the globally averaged accuracy across various reasoning tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better reasoning ability of the trained models on the tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Qwen-32B and DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Llama-70B models, showing improvements in accuracy across all tests.
methodology.validation: Data validation included rigorous checking of responses against reference answers and test cases, ensuring reliability.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential inaccuracies in generated responses due to reliance on large language models.
